numlitem.para: Both pack Temperature Sensors for associated pack are operative,
Both pack Temperature Control channels for associated Pack are operative, and
Boeing Service Bulletin 747-21-2337 or production equivalent is incorporated.

note.para: Service Bulletin 747-21-2337 has been accomplished on all UPS aircraft.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard the affected Pack switch "PACK OVERHEAT SWITCH INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with the associated pack(s) operating, deactivate the affected Overheat switch as follows:
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Gain access to the affected pack through the appropriate Air Conditioning Pack Access Door located on the underside of the aircraft.
Disconnect, cap, and stow the affected electrical connector from the Pack Overheat Switch installed in the Pack Discharge Duct. Connector part numbers are:
For dispatch with the affected pack inoperative, use DMP item 21-51-1.

caution.para: IF PACK TEMPERATURE CONTROLLER P/N S210U130-41 (OR LATER) IS NOT INSTALLED, ASSOCIATED PACKS WILL NOT HAVE AUTOMATIC SHUTDOWN PROTECTION WHEN THE PACK OVERHEAT SWITCH IS INOPERATIVE. THEREFORE, DISPATCH MUST BE RESTRICTED TO ONLY ONE ASSOCIATED PACK AND IT MUST BE CONSIDERED INOPERATIVE.
